thread.title: Coca-Cola launches new designs for Zero, Diet and Stevia | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Coca-Cola launches new designs for Zero, Diet and Stevia | Daily Mail Online

author: Cindy Tran For Daily Mail Australia
title: Coca-Cola launches new designs for Zero, Diet and Stevia | Daily Mail Online
text: Can YOU pick the Real Thing? Coca-Cola rolls out its first can and bottle redesign in 130 years - but will customers be able to tell the difference? Global beverage giant Coca-Cola has given a new look to all of its soda range Classic, Zero, Diet Coke and Coke with Stevia, will feature the iconic 'red disc' But the flavours would still be identified to the colours associated to them Diet Coke cans are silver, Coke Zero cans are black and Coke Stevia is green The change will prominently feature the iconic red disc on all its products The new designs will roll out across Australian stores from Monday, February 6 The 'One Brand' design has already been released in Mexico and the UK Published: 02:43 GMT, 2 February 2017 | Updated: 07:35 GMT, 2 February 2017 88 shares
